page.title: 12The Jumbles (continued)
page.content: relatively undisturbed.Great Crested Grebes are now common and other birds such as Herons and Whooper Swans are increasing in number.Wild flowers such as Devils-bit Scabious,Knapweed and Sweet Cicely grow there.The most common tree is the Alder but evergreen conifers are being planted.It is hoped to create an animal habitat. The country park is easily reached by public transport and there is a car park.There is a country park warden who liaises with local schools and leads guided walks in the summer. Beneath the water is Horrobin Mill.It was a fulling mill and bleachworks from 1780 to 1941.Many bleachworks and papermills further down the valley were once powered by Bradshaw Brook.A few interesting remains of this industrial past can be seen on the nature trail.
